pli-tv-kd14:4.4.34: _Idaṃ saṃghassa katikasaṇṭhānaṃ, imaṃ kālaṃ pavisitabbaṃ, imaṃ kālaṃ nikkhamitabbanti_. See [](pli-tv-kd18:1.2.22) for the correct interpretation of this line.
pli-tv-kd14:4.11.2: _Sānuvādo_. [Vin-vn-ṭ.2777](): _Sānuvādoti ettha anuvādo nāma codanā, saha anuvādena vattatīti sānuvādo_, “_Sānuvādo_: here accusing is called _anuvādo_. _Sānuvādo_ means he proceeds with an accusation.”
pli-tv-kd14:10.1.3: The Pali just says “he knows”, _jānāti_, but it seems implied that this refers to the manager. [Sp.4.204](): _Jānātīti salākaṃ gāhento jānāti “adhammavādī bahutarā”ti_, “‘He knows’: the one distributing the voting tickets (i.e. the manager) knows that those speaking contrary to the Teaching are in the majority.”
pli-tv-kd14:13.3.1: I here follow the PTS reading, _ekatopakkhikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ_, as opposed to the Mahāsaṅgīti reading, _athāparesaṃ ekatopakkhikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ_. With the Mahāsaṅgīti reading there is no distinction between the two groups of monks.
pli-tv-kd14:14.1.1: _Bhikkhunīnaṃ anupakhajja_, lit. “intruding on the nuns”. [Sp.4.215](): _Bhikkhunīnaṃ anupakhajjāti bhikkhunīnaṃ anto pavisitvā_, “Intruding on the nuns means having entered among the nuns.” The contextual point is that he is siding with the nuns.
pli-tv-kd14:14.14.8: The Pali word _āpatti_ means both “attainment” and “offense”.
pli-tv-kd14:14.24.5: _Gahitāgahitañca jāneyya_, lit. “He should know taken and not taken.” The taking refers to the taking of voting tickets, _salāka_.
pli-tv-kd14:14.33.27: I here follow the PTS reading, _ekatopakkhikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ_, as opposed to the Mahāsaṅgīti reading, _athāparesaṃ ekatopakkhikānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ_. With the Mahāsaṅgīti reading there is no distinction between the two groups of monks.
